newsitem.title: UK: CL LAING CUTS SHELL ESTIMATES BY 10 PCT.
newsitem.headline: CL LAING CUTS SHELL ESTIMATES BY 10 PCT.

text.p: Brokerage house Credit Lyonnais Laing cut its forecasts for Shell Transport and Trading Co Plc after disappointing second quarter results.
Analyst Jurjen Lunshof cut to 5,265 million from 5,850 million for this year and to 5,565 million from 6,050 million next year. He is still recommending a "hold" trading stance on the stock.
"We see no material improvement in the second half either from refining or from oil prices and although sterling may ease further it's not going to crater," said Lunshof.
"Really the cut is based on oil price considerations. We had a strong second half last year which we don't envisage this year and we don't expect the underlying environment to improve," he said.

Shell shares slipped 23p to 450p after news that second quarter profits fell short with current cost net income excluding special items coming in at 1.140 billion stg against forecasts of 1.26 billion and 1.48 billion.
